catalog_info.title: Animal Cognition
catalog_info.notes: Not open to students who have taken PSY 1351.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: The Psychology Department requires completion of Science of Living Systems 20 (or equivalent) and at least one foundational course from PSY 14, PSY 15, PSY 18 or Science of Living Systems 15 before enrolling in this course.
catalog_info.description: This course is an introduction to the study of animal cognition and thought processes. Topics include categorization, memory, number concepts, insight, and language-like behavior. The course requires reading and critiquing original journal articles.
